verses.verse: Then Eliphaz<WH464> the Temanite<WH8489> answered<WH6030> and said,<WH559>
If we attempt to commune<WH5254> <WH1697> with<WH413> thee, wilt thou be grieved?<WH3811> but who<WH4310> can<WH3201> withhold<WH6113> himself from speaking?<WH4405>
Behold, <WH2009> thou hast instructed<WH3256> many,<WH7227> and thou hast strengthened<WH2388> the weak<WH7504> hands.<WH3027>
Thy words<WH4405> have upheld<WH6965> him that was falling,<WH3782> and thou hast strengthened<WH553> the feeble<WH3766> knees.<WH1290>
But <WH3588> now<WH6258> it is come<WH935> upon<WH413> thee, and thou faintest;<WH3811> it toucheth<WH5060> <WH5704> thee, and thou art troubled.<WH926>
Is not<WH3808> this thy fear,<WH3374> thy confidence,<WH3690> thy hope,<WH8615> and the uprightness<WH8537> of thy ways?<WH1870>
Remember, <WH2142> I pray thee,<WH4994> who<WH4310> ever perished,<WH6> being innocent?<WH5355> or where<WH375> were the righteous<WH3477> cut off?<WH3582>
Even as<WH834> I have seen,<WH7200> they that plow<WH2790> iniquity,<WH205> and sow<WH2232> wickedness,<WH5999> reap<WH7114> the same.
By the blast<WH4480> <WH5397> of God<WH433> they perish,<WH6> and by the breath<WH4480> <WH7307> of his nostrils<WH639> are they consumed.<WH3615>
The roaring<WH7581> of the lion,<WH738> and the voice<WH6963> of the fierce lion,<WH7826> and the teeth<WH8127> of the young lions,<WH3715> are broken.<WH5421>
The old lion<WH3918> perisheth<WH6> for lack<WH4480> <WH1097> of prey,<WH2964> and the stout lion's<WH3833> whelps<WH1121> are scattered abroad.<WH6504>
Now a thing<WH1697> was secretly brought<WH1589> to<WH413> me, and mine ear<WH241> received<WH3947> a little<WH8102> thereof.<WH4480>
In thoughts<WH5587> from the visions<WH4480> <WH2384> of the night,<WH3915> when deep sleep<WH8639> falleth<WH5307> on<WH5921> men,<WH376>
Fear <WH6343> came upon<WH7122> me, and trembling,<WH7460> which made all<WH7230> my bones<WH6106> to shake.<WH6342>
Then a spirit<WH7307> passed<WH2498> before<WH5921> my face;<WH6440> the hair<WH8185> of my flesh<WH1320> stood up: <WH5568>

It stood still,<WH5975> but I could not<WH3808> discern<WH5234> the form<WH4758> thereof: an image<WH8544> was before<WH5048> mine eyes,<WH5869> there was silence,<WH1827> and I heard<WH8085> a voice,<WH6963> saying,
Shall mortal man<WH582> be more just than God?<WH6663> <WH4480> <WH433> shall a man<WH1397> be more pure<WH2891> than his maker?<WH4480> <WH6213>
Behold, <WH2005> he put no trust<WH539> <WH3808> in his servants;<WH5650> and his angels<WH4397> he charged<WH7760> with folly: <WH8417>
How much less<WH637> in them that dwell in<WH7931> houses<WH1004> of clay,<WH2563> whose<WH834> foundation<WH3247> is in the dust,<WH6083> which are crushed<WH1792> before<WH6440> the moth?<WH6211>
They are destroyed<WH3807> from morning<WH4480> <WH1242> to evening:<WH6153> they perish<WH6> forever<WH5331> without any<WH4480> <WH1097> regarding<WH7760> it.
Doth not<WH3808> their excellency<WH3499> which is in them go away?<WH5265> they die,<WH4191> even without<WH3808> wisdom.<WH2451>
